Wikipedia contains 5,581,457 pages.
There are a total of 430,591,151 links between Wikipedia pages.
8,183,376 Wikipedia pages are actually just redirects to other pages.
"List of current U.S. state legislators" is the Wikipedia page with the highest number of outgoing links (9,770).
"List of people from Illinois" is the Wikipedia page with the second highest number of outgoing links (8,049).
"List of least concern birds" is the Wikipedia page with the third highest number of outgoing links (7,903).
"List of stage names" is the Wikipedia page with the fourth highest number of outgoing links (6,674).
"List of birds of the world" is the Wikipedia page with the fifth highest number of outgoing links (6,232).
"Geographic coordinate system" is the most linked to page on Wikipedia (1,050,889 incoming links).
"International Standard Book Number" is the second most linked to page on Wikipedia (963,905 incoming links).
"United States" is the third most linked to page on Wikipedia (475,101 incoming links).
"Virtual International Authority File" is the fourth most linked to page on Wikipedia (431,066 incoming links).
"Taxonomy (biology)" is the fifth most linked to page on Wikipedia (360,413 incoming links).
The first Wikipedia page title in alphabetical order is "!!".
The last Wikipedia page title in alphabetical order is "ùïä".
361 Wikipedia pages (0.006% of all pages) have no incoming or outgoing links.
There are only 1,272 Wikipedia pages (0.02% of all pages) which link to no other pages.
There are 156,864 Wikipedia pages (2.81% of all pages) which are not linked to from any other page.

At an impressive 211 characters, "Suzukake no Ki no Michi de "Kimi no Hohoemi o Yume ni Miru" to Itte Shimattara Bokutachi no Kankei wa D≈ç Kawatte Shimau no ka, Bokunari ni Nannichi ka Kangaeta Ue de no Yaya Kihazukashii Ketsuron no Y≈ç na Mono" is the longest page title on Wikipedia.
There are 254 Wikipedia pages (0.005% of all pages) whose titles are just a single character, including "≈í", "‚Üì", and "ËÜæ".
Only 17 Wikipedia page titles begin with an exclamation mark, one of which is "!O!ung_language".
8,857 Wikipedia pages (0.16%) have a title which contains an exclamation mark.
Only 16 Wikipedia page titles begin with a question mark, one of which is "?:_A_Question_Mark".
3,612 Wikipedia pages (0.06%) have a title which contains a question mark.
4,843,356 Wikipedia pages (86.8%) have a title which contains a space.
738,101 Wikipedia pages (13.2%) have a title which does not contain a space.
A single or double quotation mark can be found in 161,487 Wikipedia page titles (2.89% of all page titles), leading to countless parsing issues while creating this.

The "List of lists of lists" page is a list of pages that are lists of list pages on the English Wikipedia.
The "Order of magnitude" page lists "yocto-" (10^-24) and "yotta-" (10^24) as the smallest and largest magnitude prefixes.
The "Names of large numbers" page contains words like "googol" (10^100) and "millinillion" (10^3003).
An "Illegal prime" is a prime number that represents information whose possession or distribution is forbidden in some legal jurisdictions.
